Headline: Bus Substitution Between Illinois Medical District and UIC-Halsted
ShortDescription: Shuttle buses replace Blue Line service between Illinois Medical District and UIC-Halsted.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Shuttle buses replace rail service between Illinois Medical District and UIC-Halsted.

Trains will run between O’Hare and UIC-Halsted, and between Forest Park and Illinois Medical District.

Allow extra travel time.

Why is service being changed?
We are performing construction at the Racine Blue Line station and Morgan substation.

MAP

Headline: Delays on Loop 'L' (elevated lines)
ShortDescription: Brown, Green, Orange, Purple & Pink Line trains are experiencing delays due to fire department activity near Washington/Wabash.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Brown, Green, Orange, Purple & Pink Line trains are experiencing delays due to fire department activity near Washington/Wabash.

Crews are working to correct the problem.

Allow extra travel time.

Headline: No trains between Merchandise Mart and the Loop 'L'
ShortDescription: Brown Line service has been temporarily suspended between Merchandise Mart and the Loop 'L' due to fire department activity.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Brown Line service has been temporarily suspended between Merchandise Mart and the Loop 'L' due to fire department activity.

As a result, trains are operating only between Kimball and Merchandise Mart at this time.

Shuttle buses have been requested between Merchandise Mart and Roosevelt to provide connecting service.

At this time, also consider other service alternatives that may serve your trip, such as nearby bus routes, or using buses to other rail lines.

See station personnel for further assistance, and pay attention to announcements on trains and at stations for service information.

We are working to restore service as quickly as possible. Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Service Between 54th/Cermak and Polk, then Racine (Blue Line) Stations, Only
ShortDescription: Pink Line trains operate from 54th to Polk only then connect w/Blue Line at Racine for continuing service due to fire department activity near Washington/Wabash

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Pink Line service has been temporarily suspended between Polk and the Loop due fire department activity.

As a result, Pink Line trains are running as follows:

  • Between 54th/Cermak and Polk, and then are diverted to Racine on the Blue Line for direct connections at Racine to continuing Blue Line train service to/from downtown.

Using connecting Blue Line service:

  • For service to downtown from Pink Line stations between 54th/Cermak and Polk, take a Pink Line train toward the Loop and stay on board until the train reaches Racine on the Blue Line. Transfer to an O'Hare-bound Blue Line train from the same platform for service into downtown.

  • For service from downtown to Pink Line stations between Polk and 54th/Cermak, take a Blue Line train toward Forest Park to Racine. Stay on the same platform side and wait for a 54th/Cermak-bound Pink Line train.

Shuttle buses have been requested between Polk and Ashland/Lake to provide connecting service.

Other possible alternatives may include:

  • #9 Ashland
  • #21 Cermak
  • #49 Western
  • #50 Damen
  • #52 Kedzie/California
  • #53 Pulaski
  • #54 Cicero
  • #60 Blue Island-26th
  • #82 Kimball-Homan
  • #94 South California
  • #157 Streeterville-Taylor buses

...including to/from and in combination with other 'L' services.

Note that if you take a bus to/from the Pink Line, you may also be able to connect to/from the Blue Line's Forest Park branch or Green Line along Lake Street directly via that bus route.

See station personnel for further assistance, and pay attention to announcements on trains and at stations for service information.

We are working to restore service as quickly as possible. Allow extra travel time.

Headline: No Trains Between 35th and Clinton
ShortDescription: Green Line service has been temporarily suspended between 35th and Clinton due to fire department activity.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Green Line service has been temporarily suspended between 35th and Clinton due to fire department activity.

As a result, trains are operating in two sections:

  • between Harlem/Lake and Clinton, and,
  • between Roosevelt and 63rd/Cottage Grove and Ashland/63rd, only.

Shuttle buses have been requested between 35th and Clinton to provide connecting service.

At this time, also consider other service alternatives that may serve your trip, such as nearby bus routes, or using buses to other rail lines.

See station personnel for further assistance, and pay attention to announcements on trains and at stations for service information.

We are working to restore service as quickly as possible. Allow extra travel time.

Headline: No trains between Halsted and the Loop 'L'
ShortDescription: Orange Line service has been temporarily suspended between Halsted and the Loop 'L' due to fire department activity.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Orange Line service has been temporarily suspended between Halsted and the Loop 'L' due to fire department activity.

As a result, trains are operating only between Midway and Halsted at this time.

Shuttle buses have been requested between Halsted and Roosevelt to provide connecting service.

At this time, also consider other service alternatives that may serve your trip, such as nearby bus routes, or using buses to other rail lines.

See station personnel for further assistance, and pay attention to announcements on trains and at stations for service information.

We are working to restore service as quickly as possible. Allow extra travel time.
